Re ''The West Sees One Mugabe, but Africa Sees Another'' (Week in Review, Aug. 6): AIDS is the biggest problem facing Zimbabwe, not land equality. Through his policy of land appropriation, President Robert Mugabe threatens to worsen the AIDS epidemic in his country.
The only way Africa will recover from the AIDS plague is through international cooperation. Africa needs more than medical and technological aid; it needs foreign investment.

But Mr. Mugabe's reforms sabotage any hopes that Zimbabwe has of attracting foreign money. No company will sink capital into a country with a reputation for stealing its citizens' assets. Though land redistribution is an important issue, Zimbabwe can ill afford to pursue it at the cost of isolating itself from foreign investment.
